page.title: 01The Wauchope Valley
page.content: Wauchope valley is a fertile stretch of land with hills up to 343m. The hills are uncultivated except for stretches of forest, but the land at lower levels is fertile, and deciduous trees grow abundantly. There are two farms in the area, Tythe House and Wauchope Farm. Sheep are kept mainly on the rough grassland, whilst cattle for beef are bred on the lower slopes. Barley, corn, silage and hay are harvested from the most fertile land. Forests, planted by the Forestry Commission, grow on the higher slopes of the hills to the east and south of the valley. Many of the trees have been felled recently, their timber going to be made into supports for mines, the building industry, etc.
